{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3524169,"name":"Magnus Nelson","username":"Magnus-Nelson","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/c77e96/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-11T23:42:17.688Z","cooked":"

Hi everyone,

I’m running into an issue when trying to enable autonomous with a named command to execute. As soon as we enable autonomous, the robot immediately disables and restarts the code without any error message. The problem happens consistently, and we’re not seeing anything in the console that indicates the cause.

From what I can tell, the robot code starts the autonomous mode, but as soon as it tries to run the named command, it seems to cause a failure that leads to a restart. The behavior is the same whether we use a simple command or a more complex one, and it’s only happening in autonomous mode. When we run the robot in teleoperated mode, everything works fine.

I’m not sure if this is an issue with the way the command is being scheduled, some sort of misconfiguration in our command subsystem setup, or a problem with how the robot is transitioning into autonomous mode.

Has anyone encountered a similar issue or found a solution? Any insights into why the robot might be restarting without any error message would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance for any help!

Here’s the Github with our code: https://github.com/2147chuck/2025-CHUCK-Code/

Edit: After trying it again with a different command, we got the following in our RioLog:

* Loop time of 0.02s overrun

* CommandScheduler loop overrun

* IntakeSubsystem.periodic(): 0.000037s

buttons.run(): 0.024078s

AlgaeSubsystem.periodic(): 0.001911s

* Warning at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Tracer.lambda$printEpochs$0(Tracer.java:62): IntakeSubsystem.periodic(): 0.000037s

* CommandSwerveDrivetrain.periodic(): 0.005008s

* ElevatorSubsystem.periodic(): 0.000167s

disabledInit(): 0.002764s
